name: WHYCOMP002: Graphical Score
h4: Winning tracks will be released on "WHYCOMP002: Graphical Score", set to release in December
rules: 2. If you use samples, they must be royalty free
4. We will provide a graphical score that you can create your audio file to. Be sure to view the resources to understand what a graphical score is and how you can the one we provide

5. Your song should closely resemble what your interpretation of the score sounds like. If your song does not sounds like it goes along with the graphical score, it will not be considered in the final picks for the album.
6. Submit your final track mixed and mastered to __email__ as a downloadable 44.1Khz wav file.
7. Title your track __i__"artist_name - track_name.wav"__i__ and be sure to stylize your artist name and song name correctly
recommendations: Genre of music does not matter for this album
Collabs are good ways to make new friends and make cool sounds
We will be creating visualizers for each song based on the length of time of your song. The video representation of the score will be sped up or slowed down to match the length of your audio file.

resources.Info: Visit this link to view or download the score as a PDF or SVG.

resources.Resources: Visit these links to see more information about graphical scores.

disclosure: Members of WRC will be participating in the competition, as well as judging the tracks submitted. Our goal is to include as many tracks as possible, so we will probably not turn away a track unless it does not follow the rules or fit the criteria for the album. All proceeds made on this album go to the record label and are put towards promotion of the album and other releases

name: WHYCOMP001: Rain
h4: Winning tracks were released on "WHYCOMP001 - Rain", set to release in November
rules: 2. If you use samples, they must be royalty free

3. Theme: __b__Rain__b__ (you should create a track that embodies "rain"; perhaps this means you use rain recordings, synthesize the sound of rain, use rain as an inspiration for your track structure / lyrics, create a rain soundscape using only sounds that are not rain, etc.)
4. You cannot use "Rain" in your track title, as it is the album name
5. No beats (drums can be used, but that kind of defeats the purpose of 'ambient', so use them creatively if you decide to use them at all)
6. Submit your final track mixed and mastered to __email__ as a downloadable 44.1Khz wav file.
recommendations: Ambient / Drone / "peaceful noises" / Field Recordings / Sound Scapes / etc. are most likely to be selected for the album
Collabs are good ways to make new friends and make cool sounds
disclosure: Members of WRC will be participating in the competition, as well as judging the tracks submitted. Our goal is to include as many tracks as possible, so we will probably not turn away a track unless it does not follow the rules or fit the criteria for the album. All proceeds made on this album go to the record label and are put towards promotion of the album and other releases
